1:
Yahweh, for David's sake call to mind
\q all his afflictions.
\q
2:
Call to mind how he swore to Yahweh,
\q how he vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob.
3:
He said, "I will not enter my house
\q or get into my bed,
\q
4:
I will not give sleep to my eyes
\q or rest to my eyelids
\q
5:
until I find a place for Yahweh,
\q a tabernacle for the Mighty One of Jacob."
8:
Arise, Yahweh, to your resting place,
\q you and the ark of your strength!
10:
For your servant David's sake,
\q do not turn away from your anointed king.
11:
Yahweh swore a sure oath to David,
\q a sure oath that he will not revoke:
\q "I will place one of your descendants on your throne.
\q
12:
If your sons keep my covenant
\q and the laws that I will teach them,
\q their children also will sit on your throne forevermore."
13:
Certainly Yahweh has chosen Zion,
\q he has desired her for his seat.
\q
14:
"This is my resting place forever.
\q I will live here, for I desire her.
15:
I will abundantly bless her with provisions.
\q I will satisfy her poor with bread.
\q
16:
I will clothe her priests with salvation,
\q her faithful ones will shout aloud for joy.
17:
There I will make a horn to sprout for David
\q and set up a lamp for my anointed one.
\q
18:
I will clothe his enemies with shame,
\q but on him his crown will shine."
